"What is needed in Appalachia is something
different...something new...vibrant...dynamic...
to get through to people. If a responsible
educational broadcaster were to propose a
programming project involving practical, and
basic values during daytime and evening hours
on a full-time basis, it would well behoove
ARC (Appalachian Regional Commission) to
consider backing such a project to the fullest
extent of its capability. The people of
Appalachia, as much and possibly more than any
other Americans, need effective mass interÂ¬
communication of information which they will
find valuable in their lives. They need it as
soon as possible."
The title of Mr. Fellows' report is "Educational
Broadcasting As A Tool For Appalachian Development",
and was written in June of 1966.
